titleStmt.title: Iacobi à Falckenburgk, Germani, Casimirus, siue, De concertatione Eliæ cum Baalistis paraphrasis sacra pro cultus solius Iehovæ viui defensione & idololatriæ detestatione cupidiss, ad sereniss augustiss. q[uae] principem ac Dominam Dn. Elizabetham Angliæ, Franciæ & Hiberniæ Reginam gloriosiss. fidei defensatricem opt. max. Dominam suam longè clementiss. : in secundos & prosperrimos regiminis anni 21 incarnationis Christi 1579, auspicij, Maiestatem ipsius illustrissimo Palatino Rheni Iohanne Casimiro Duce Bauariæ, fœliciss. illo ex belli Belgici Castris accedente, & aliquot Europæ procerum legatis de rebus Christianitatis grauissimis consultationum nomine apud eandem præsentibus successus, subiectionis humilimæ adeoq[ue] afflictorum commiserationis ergò F.D.P.
titleStmt.author: Falckenburg, Jakob.

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 24 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 8 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

titleStmt.title: Iacobi à Falckenburgk, Germani, Casimirus, siue, De concertatione Eliæ cum Baalistis paraphrasis sacra pro cultus solius Iehovæ viui defensione & idololatriæ detestatione cupidiss, ad sereniss augustiss. q[uae] principem ac Dominam Dn. Elizabetham Angliæ, Franciæ & Hiberniæ Reginam gloriosiss. fidei defensatricem opt. max. Dominam suam longè clementiss. : in secundos & prosperrimos regiminis anni 21 incarnationis Christi 1579, auspicij, Maiestatem ipsius illustrissimo Palatino Rheni Iohanne Casimiro Duce Bauariæ, fœliciss. illo ex belli Belgici Castris accedente, & aliquot Europæ procerum legatis de rebus Christianitatis grauissimis consultationum nomine apud eandem præsentibus successus, subiectionis humilimæ adeoq[ue] afflictorum commiserationis ergò F.D.P.
titleStmt.author: Falckenburg, Jakob.

publicationStmt.date: 22 Ianuarij die mihi nigra & notabili, anno CI[C].I[C]. LXXTX [i.e. 22 Jan. 1579]

notesStmt.note: Formerly pt. 2 of STC 10673--Cf. STC (2nd ed.).
Reproduction of original in the Wadham College. Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,368 texts created during Phase 1 of the project (2000-2009), initially available only to institutions that contributed to their creation, were released into the public domain on 1 January 2015. The approximately 40,000 texts produced during Phase 2 (2009- ), of which 34,963 had been released as of 2020, originally similarly restricted, were similarly freed from all restrictions on 1 August 2020. As of that date anyone is free to take and use these texts for any purpose (modify them, annotate them, distribute them, etc.). But we do respectfully request that due credit and attribution be given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

revisionDesc.change: 2010-01 SPi GlobalKeyed and coded from ProQuest page images
2010-03 Ali JakobsonText and markup reviewed and edited

div.p: Iacobi à Falckenburgk, Germani, ❧ CASIMIRVS, Siue de concertatione Eliae cum Baaliſtis, paraphraſis ſacra.
PRO Cultus ſolius IEHOƲAE viui defenſione & idololatriae detestatione cupidiſs.

AD Sereniſs. auguſtiſs.
que principem ac Dominam, DN. ELIZABETHAM Angliae, Franciae & Hiberniae Reginam glorioſiſs. fidei defenſatricem opt. max. Dominam ſuam longê clementiſs.

IN Secundos & proſperrimos Regiminis anni 21. incarnationis Christi, 1579. auspicij, Maieſtatem ipſius illuſtriſsimo Palatino Rheni Iohanne Caſimiro Duce Bauariae, foeliciſs. illo ex belli Belgici Caſtris accedente, & aliquot Europae Procerum legatis de rebus Chriſtianitatis grauiſsimis Conſultationum nomine apud eandem praeſentibus, SVCCESSVS, Subiectionis humilimae, adeo
que afflictorum commiſerationis ergò F. D. P.
LONDINI Typis Richardi Graphei. 22. Ianuarij die, mihi nigra & notabili, Anno. M.D.LXXIX.

div.head:
IDYLLION, CONTINENS ACERrimam D. Eliae prophetae, in monte Carmelo, cum ſacrificulis BAALAE Cōcertationem, delirijs diſſidijs
que noſtri quoque ſaeculi Religioſorum inſanis quàm maximè conuenientem, conſolationis & ſuiipſius & aliorum iniuriam patientium cauſa P. P. ex 3. Reg. 18.
div.stage: ELIAS. OBADAEVS. ACHABVS. BAALISTAE. HEBRAE I.

sp.l: QƲid querar? Vnde petam ſummi primordia luctus,

Optime coelicolûm rector, mundi
que creator?
Gignere nonne queat mihi ſollicitudinis anſam
Maximus aeternum crucians dolor, oſſe medullam
Qui vorat, & liuens miſeros depaſcitur artus?
En premit exilium, vaſto dum luctor eremo▪
Me crudelis, atrox, ac inuidioſa tyrannis,

Tempore quo regnis, Samaritano
que ſenatu
Expulit, haec cogens ſpaelaea habitare ferarum,
Sola miniſterio Coruorum vita ſuperstes
Eſt mea, qui referunt obſonia frigida parcè.
Sicca leuanda ſit is limo ſi gurgite Criti.

Is quo
que diffugiens, partim Iordanis in alueum
Abſtulit agmen aquae: partim ſiccatus arenas
Ʋix poterat bibulas defendere ſolis ab aeſtu,
Tota quoad perijt ſubstantia fluxa Cauernis.
Torrida ſic aeſtas, grauis & penuria aquâi
Eſt modò, ne guttam vt pluuiae produxerit Auſter.
Quinetiam atra fames, non exaudita priori
Progenie, terram rebus naſcentibus orbam
Stringit, & in culmos prohibet conſurgere meſſem.
Fruſtra operatur humus: ſementem per didit ingens
Aeſtus, & irriguus tellure reconditur humor.

Arborei foetus, oleae, vitis
que racemi
Diriguêre diu languenti ſtemmate, & arent

Foecundante prius ſata quae
que per arua, liquore.

Dixi ego perfrictae genti, rebar
que futurum
Excidium hoc homicidarum, Ducis, atque Sabellae,
Quae, canibus laceranda ſuis, trux limine in ipſo
Occidet, infauſtos conspergens ſanguine poſtes.
Ecce autem, tot criminibus, ſanctiſſime mundi
Conditor, irritatus adhuc tua munera genti
Mittere conſtituis periurae? cum pluuioſa
Fructificos imbres vis tempeſtate reduci?
Aſt mihi ſi vires (quae te mihi dante futuro
Aduenient) nunc ſint, tonitru cum fulminis aura
Depluet hos ſuper ex adytis fumantis olympi.

Euge, tuum numen, tua
que inculpabilis aeuo

Sit bonitas, vigeat ſanctiſſima vbi
que voluntas.
Propicius, clemens, miſerator es At tua fulmen
Cur rotat, elatum dextra, id niſi mittis in orbem?
Si minitaris ab hac releuat miſeratio ab illa
Parte ſcelus populi, nunquam mea dicta ſequuti.

Funditus eruerem nocuos, populum
que ſcelestum.
Ibo animis contrà, Golian ſeu praeſtet atrocem,
Siue, ſui ſimiles, Achabos ter mille cruentos.
Cotibus exacuam gladium, licet inſcius vſus.
Imperium ne ſi dominae, & mandata faceſſet
Improbus, interitus ſine caede, & ſangume noſter
Multorum eueniat, feriet quos Theſbius enſis.

sp.speaker: OBAD.
sp.l: Elia, ô ſerue DEI celſiſſimi, amabo,
Ʋnde venis? peregrè huc reducem ſaluere precatur
Haec anima, hîc Obadaeus ego ipſe, frequentibus opto
Auſpicijs venias. Qua non regione viarum
Iam perueſtigatus ades, ſanctiſſime vatum?

lg.l: Auſpicijs ain? His forſan, quibus • ger in antro
Delitui, quo me deſerti inamabile luſtrum,
Humanae prohibens, tenuit, commertia linguae.
Solliciti paſtus noſtri niſi pabula Corui
Vnguibus, aëria & roſtro regione tuliſſent.
Nec tuus Elias, nec viueret iſte propheta.
Ocyus, euge, redi, ſi carcer, apoſtata, tortor,
Viuit adhuc Achabus (ſi viuere dignus in orbe)
Me redijſſe refer, nolit, velit, impia coniunx.
Ille mihi rapiat nudata fronte capillum?
Elian dicas Achabo redijſſe furenti.

sp.speaker: OBAD.
sp.l: Parce animae miſerae, vatū clariſs. Theſbi.

Nan
que ego ſi hinc abeo, nec veri nuntia fama
Conſtiterit penitus, Rege adueniente, meorum
Verborum indicio, (velut eſt furioſus) ad vnguem
Tondebit miſerum, laniato viſcere, corpus.
Non regio in terris vlla eſt, quam iuſſa Tyranni,
Supplicium de te poſcentis, non petiêre,
Aut tibi vel ſaltem vt placari poſſet, egeſtas
Dum terras immenſatenet, ceſſantibus aruis
Germina progenerare, velut prius aucta tulêre.
Te ſipneuma DEI (velut antehac ſaepius iſiud
Contigit) abriperet, quid adhuc miſero mihi reſtat
Quàm tortura grauis vitae, cum crimine falſi?

sp.speaker: FLI.
sp.l: Tu gradere, Elian Regi redijſſe referto.

Testor vtrun
que caput, mea non abſentia vitae
Adferet vlla tuae diſcrimen, atroxuè periclunt.
Perge modo. Elian vatem redijſſe referto.

sp.speaker: OBAD.
sp.l: Alme Deus, qui nunc per tanta pericla reducis

Oh exoptatum dominum, columen
que piorum,
Quos ego ſollicitè praerupti fornice ſaxi
Nutrio, felices reditus largire Prophetae.
Quae ſitum toto, Rex auguſtiſſime, mundo
Inueni ELIAN, vult is tua ſponte videre
Ora redux: myrto en ſubter frondente reſedit.
Non ille eſuriem paſſus, nec vultus iniquo
Sic pallore riget tenuatus, vt arbitrer illum
Frugali hoſpitio peregrè, paſtumuè cicadis.

sp.speaker: ACH.
sp.l: Tune canis redijſſe virum? Non protinus auſus
Attrahere, aut placidis ſubitò huc deducere verbis?
Dic vbi liquiſti? Quo ſe ſubduxerat ille?
En venit at rigidum ſat ſentiet eſſe Monarcham,

Cuius ab imperio fugit, regnum
que reliquit
Perfidus, eſurtem cum ſenſit adeſſe malignam.
Hem profuge. Eccum aderas? Tun'ille feroculus audes
Iſraëliticam, turbato foedere, gentem

Aduerſus Diuos animare, Balam
que potentem?

sp.speaker: ELI.
sp.l: Non ego progenitos Abrahae de ſemine quicquam

Turbaui: Tua progenies, tu
que , ardue, turpis

Defenſor Baalae turbas gentem
que , tribus
que
Hebrigenûm, impietate furens idola colendo,
Cunctipotente DEO, cultu illius atque relicto.

Verum agè certemus ſignis, ſacris
que ſuperno
Ritè ſecundatis à numine, caelitus vſque
Haec ea Carmeli peragantur vertice cepta.
Tu Baalae cunctos (age) flamines (euge) miniſtros,
Atque ſuperſtitioſam turbam coge: recenſe
Concilivm, vt lucos, ſublimia templa, Sabaeo
Ture vaporatas incenſo conſecret aras.
Colluuies horum magna eſt licet: attamen ipſe
Auxilio fretus ſolius numinis almi,
Coelicolûm domino taurum mactabo ſecuri.
Istud idem faciant, quorum cadat hostia dextra,
Sacrifici Baalae: ſimilis ſit ritus, & ordo
Mactandae pecudis, spargendi in ſacra cruoris.
Abſit at incenſo, ac holocaustis omnis vtrinque
Ignea vis ſilicis, fomes tollatur & omnis.

Iam quicun
que DEVS, rutilis placatus ab aſtris,
Auspicijs operum ceptis pius annuet, ignem

Deijciet, ſigno
que ſuum teſtabitur alto
Propitius numen, DEVS esto immenſus in ae • um.
Si Baalae tanta eſt virtus, responſa per auras
Mittet, vt electis cultoribus igne ſonoro,

Mactatum
que pecus per ſumma altaria aduret,
Ʋictus ero, hoc animo lethum me cum antè peregi.
Sin vero, ô Zebaoth, testaberis aethere flamma

Ignipotente tuum numen, ſigno
que coruſco.
Hem, ſic mactatos, rapidi torrentis ad vndas,
Sic perimam, vt pereat cum gente ſcientia cultus.

sp.speaker: HEB.
sp.l: Non petit abſurdum, Rex augustiſſime, quicquam.
Non truculens facinus, nos relligione priori
Turpiter auulſos, prorſum ignorare, Tonantis
Numina quanta ſient, terrarum qui regit orbem?
Polluit in tantum ſacri mysteria cultus:
Cuncta ſacerdotum quoniam vaniſſimus error,

Vt nihil attentes, quod non fallax
que , nocenſ
que ,
Si probet ad normam diuini regula iuris.

sp.speaker: ACH.
sp.l: Vos igitur Diuûm cunctis indicite honorem,
Publicolae, per me liceat: non ipſe vetabo
Sacra Balae, metuens ſolius coniugis iram.
Extra ſum noxam penitus, ſi quid DEVS ipſe,
Cunctorum ac dominans dominantûm, fecerit orbe,
Numinis ad ſummi illustrandam maiestatem.
Inclemens taceo fatum, Pharaonis, & atrox
Supplicium, tulerat Zephyrus quem turbidus ira,
Horrendum in pelagus, cum tempeſtate ſonora:
Ieroboam cunctis ſubeat, qui numina falſa

Mentitus Danai populo, excelſae
que Bethelae.
Quàm miſerè ille Silonites (proh) occidit augur,
Ariolans Ahias, non iuſſa ſequutus Olympi?
Quàm miſerè perijt deperditus enſe Baëſae.

sp.speaker: HEB.
sp.l: Haec eadem nostra eſt cura, inuictiſſime Princeps
Inquiramus vt hunc, quem Moſes, nostra vetustas
Sanctorum & venerata patrum, ſanctiſſimus Aron

Et Patriarcharum coetus, Dauid
que fidelis.
Terribilis quondam fuit & fortiſſimus axis
Fulminei domitor, qui tot miranda per orbem

Prodigijs operatus erat terra
que mari
que
Coelitus is dederat Moſae ſignante perenni
Articulo tabulas, Legis venerabile donum.

Is quo
que perpetuis dominandam legibus vrbem

Inſtituit, firmans regnum, ſanctam
que Sionem.
Hic ſimulachra nihil praeter conſpeximus vnquam
Aerea, & excoctum calidis fornacibus aurum.
Num Baalas poſuit fulgentem nubibus irim?
Iuſſit ad indomitos ſolem perstare Tyrannos?
Rexit in indomitos pueri Dauidis an arma,
Et fundam, Allophilos, Golia recidente ſuperbo?

Te fera fata prement, ô Rex, niſipurus honor
que
Relligionis erit, tanti & custodia cultus
Firmior. Eſt ingens ſcelus irritare Tonantem
Accidia, & torpore Ducum, qui numina temnunt.
Ergo nunc mandato, agè, Rex: imponere morem

Nil iuuat his ceptis, te ter
que quater
que rogamus,
Ne nos perpetuò ſancti ignorantia cultus
Ludificet, Diuûm quae cognitione laborat.

sp.speaker: BAAL.
sp.l: Audiſti, vt noſtros, Achabe ô clariſs. princeps,

Efferus, at
que procax, vocat in certamina Diuos,
Theſbius, apprenſum quem non laniena Sabellae
Theotocae rapuit, centum iugulando prophetas,
Qui Baalae nostro contradixêre ſcelesti?
Venimus, atque tuis iuſſis parêre volentes,
Hunc prius expetimus, huic confringemus & artus,

Carnificum
que vices ſubituri, membra ſecuri
Conficiemus adhaec, miſcentes ritè cruorem
Incenſis Baalae, fieri qui talia mandat.

sp.speaker: ACH.
sp.l: Parcite, crudeles, conſpergere ſanguine cornu
Altaris rutilum, ſignis certetur vtrinque.
Si ferus, atque procax vocat in certamina multos
Theſbius vnus: habebit & is temerarius auſus
Praemia digna: dabit meritas praeſumptio poenas.
At ſivos vincet, fuerit quam dedecus ingens?

Quiſ
que furor populi? iam vos perpendite, amici.
Barbaries ea magna foret, trux atque tyrannis,
Vi premere inſontem, cui fert ſuffragia vitae

Innocuae pietas, constans tutela Dei
que .
Nunc iuuet accitos vos tantae noſcere cauſa:
Seditionis, & haec nouitas vnde orta tumultus.
ELIAN vocat ista cohors: ſecedite turbae,
Ipſe ſuam cauſam tractabit rectius actor.

sp.speaker: ELI.
sp.l: Dî nemorum, veniunt quot in haec certamina Sphinges
Centauri, Satyri, quot vaſta mole Gygantes?
Colligit vnde (precor) ſemet chorus iste Cyclopum,

Quos Baalae reditus, altare fouet
que prophanum?
Nonn' ego nunc lachrymem? non tristia fundere verba

Commediter, rerum ô domitor, mundi
que creator,
Dum tua conspicio ſanctiſſima templa nefa • do
More profanari, quae iam turpiſſimus iſte
Iuſſit adorato Rex conſecrare Satanae?
Quos video? Quae forma virûm? variata colore
Veſtis, & innumeris diſcretus legibus ordo?
Iste capillicium raſit, vel fortè cynaedus
Abstulit ô miſerae damnoſa iniuria formae.
Quid befidae mitrae, quid pendula (quaeſo) cuculla?
Quid radians fulgore nouo crinita corona?

Candida ſignificat cydaris, rubri
que galeri?
Occidis, Elia iam nullus es agmine tanto.
Accedam propius cepti vocat vltima finis.
Semper honoratus mihi ſit conſpectus, & alma
Integritas tanti coetus. Me ſumma cupido.

sp.speaker: BAAL.
sp.l: Delirat nebulo ſignum coeleste petiuit.

sp.speaker: ACH.
sp.l: Fas tamē eſto incepta loqui. ſic iura requirūt,

Ceu statuêre patres, rigidum moſae
que tribunal.
Praeco, edic ſubitò taciturna ſilentia plebi.
Sic perſtate quieti, ac percipite aure fauenti
Quae canet Elias veſtra eſt responſio tandem.

sp.speaker: ELI.
sp.l:
O excaecati populi, Satanae
que ministri,
Inſtabiles animo Quae dementauit ineptos
Impietas? Summi cur foedera temnitis axis?
Vos ſimiles eſtis fugitiuae quippe procellae,
Quam rotat in gyros Zephyri violentior aura.
Nec multum abſimiles folio, quod fluctus aquarum
Arbore deciduum, per ſaxa latentia ponti
Proripit, ac requiem negat irrequieta charybdis.
Si Balaam DEVS eſt, Baalae ſeruite benigno
Si dominus mundi DEVS eſt, ſeruite potenti
Regnatori orbis: néue immortale futurò
Ducite fas numen, ſacris violare profanis.

Vos Baalae Heroas, compello, ſacroſ
que prophetas,
Eximij ô virtute patres: altaria veſtro
Aedificate DEO, ſuper atque imponite tau • um
Ritè ſacris, viridi deductum gramine campi,

Mactatum
que ſtrue pecus id ſustollite: lignum
Adijcite arſuro, nullas tamen addite flammas.
Arida ligna ſient, ſint pinguia viſcera tauri.

Ipſe ego ſic pariter faciam, at
que píacula ducam,
Marmore de ſolido faciens altaria, voſmet
Cernite, nulla aderit prorſus ſcintilla caloris
Cui DEVS hîc flammis parti testabitur eſſe
Procliuem, celebri laudem ferat illa triumphe.
Ergo accingimini, atque rudem ſperate parati.

sp.speaker: BAAL.
sp.l: Sit, pecus id caeſum iacet altile, tollite ſeruí
Ʋiſcera quadrupedis, ſuperaddite: tollite voces
O ſocij clamore poli rumpantur, oportet.
Salue, noſtra ſalus Baalam, ſanctiſſime Diuūm,
Solus & axe potens, & amans voti, atque precatus,
Solliciti tibi quem ſoli reſonamus ad aras.
Id meruit pietas quoniam miranda per orbem,
Iuſtitia atque tuûm ſeruorum, carmine nomen
Qui celebrare tuum nunquam ceſſamus, ab alto
Mane vſque in ſeram noctem, quoad aſtra relucent.
Tu flammam largire tuis. Nam ſole ſereno

Incaluit
que dies, citius flagreſcet & aether.
Non audis? Num ſpreta tibi querimonia noſtra est?
Tot pecudes frustra mactantur,, & hoſtia templis?
Quoeſumus, exaudi. Quid? Corpora denique cogi •
Crudeli ſica proſcindere? Fundere fletus
Sanguineos? pectus rimare? effringere dentes
Stridore immeritos? ſale ſpargere vulnus adaeſum?

sp.speaker: ELI.
sp.l: ô ſtupidi. ô nimium ſocordes, numina ſic'ne

Flectitis irati Baalae, domini
que ſeueri?
Nil facitis, miſeri parna eſt reſonantia vocis
Huius apud Superos, nec habent fastidia landem.
Est Deus huic placitura oratio, credite, veſtra,

Vox modò, ceu tonitru, grauis intonet, astra
que vasto

Impete perrumpat, bellum
que indicat olympo.
Nanque habet & Baalas varium, & mutabile pectus.
Solatur forſan lemures, coeliúe Penates,
Aut radio terras pingit, ſcrutatur & vndas
Oceani: aut dormit: recreat vel ſemet aquarum
Gurgite: vel certè viridi ſpaciatur in aruo.
Vociferamini adhuc, clemens est, atque benignus,
Quaratione igitur non audiet ille vocantes? fruſtra

sp.speaker: BAAL.
sp.l: Nil nostri miſerere, pater? Rex maxime?

Fundimus has noſtras
que preces, tepidum
que cruorem,
Saucia rimamus dum corpora tota ſagittis?
Vae noſtris aeuo, vae, manibus, improbe, quorum

Exitij caput es, tu
que execrabilis autor.
Quis tibi confidat, Diuûm turpiſſime Auerni,
De te ſi nullum ſuperest ſolamen in orbe?

sp.speaker: ACH.
sp.l: Quid facis Elia? Tibi num tua numina, reris,
Efficient, nequeunt quod tot praeſtare prophetae,

Integritas operum quos tollit, honor
que ſacelli?
Solus es, & tantam ſermone laceſſere turbam

Octingentorum, quinquaginta
que virorum
Auſus in hanc temerè veniſti ſponte palestram?

lg.l: Vos famuli, grandem foſſam mihi ducite ſulco,
Rectè est inſtruitote pyram, ſint ordine iunctae
Congeries lignorum: annectite faſcis acernos.
Tollite iam vaſtum collecto tergore taurum,

Sublatum
que focis imponite, victima ſacris
Ceu ſolet imponi, patrum de more vetuſto:
Sic ſatis eſt. Implete cados iam gurgite aquarum.
Spargite nunc tota perfuſa holocauſta fluento.

Hoc iterum facitote natent lapides
que ſtrues
que
Lignorum: haud multum refert. Opus omne ſolutum
Fiet, vbi largo ſtagnabit flumine tellus.
Inclyta, cuncta vides haec, gens DEVS omine faust •
Prosperet inceptum: paulo ſecedite, amici,
Ad latus atque meum pueri conſistite dextrum.
Et nos numen amat, ſummo pia ſemper apud me

Munera ſunt, caſtae
que preces, & vota ſerena.
Et me principiò ſanctiſſimus autor Olympi,
(Cuius ſacra fero, ingenti perculſus amore)

Accipiat, dextra
que regat pietate clientem.
O DEVS, ô Abrahae spes, atque columna tuorum
Diuigenûm Hebraeûm, populo fac conſtet in iſto
(Quaeſo) die, quòd tu DEVS Iſraelis, & auctor
Vnicus optatae ſis pacis, & vnica vitae

Arx, columen
que meae: quòd ſis contemtor & horum,
Nomina qui tua nunc quaeſitae fraude profanant.
Cognoſcant etiam cuncti, quod ſeruus ego ipſe
Sim tuus, ac cuncta haec te ſic mandante peregi.
Nunc, DEVS omnipotens, audi, & miſerere precantis
(O) Pueri: dignere etiam conuertere tanti
Cor populi, qui prodigijs hac rupe docendus.

sp.speaker: HEB.
sp.l: Eheu, quin fugimus? Ruit ecce ſonor us ab axe
Ignis, & immenſo conquaſſat fulmine montem.

sp.speaker: ELI.
sp.l: Ne fugite: auxiliator adeſt, DEVS ille ſalutis,
Quem colimus, ſolum trepidamus vbique ſecundis
Seruate ô voſmet, facit haec Rex magnus olympi.
Ne trepidate viri. DEVS eſt victoria noſtra.

Vos, pueros animate, ſenes, teneras
que puellas,
Numine confortate DEI, propiore Deorum.

sp.speaker: HEB.
sp.l: En ſumus incolumes cuncti, ſanctiſſime vates,
Protector noſter, Deus Iſraëlis, adeſto.
Tu decus, Elia, noſtrum: tu ſancta repoſcis
Numina, tu vitae ſacratum dogma reportas.
Protector noſter Deus eſt, Deus ipſe Deorum
Extra hunc nulla ſalus, nulla eſt ſaluatio plebis
Iſraëliticae, dominus Deus iſte Deorum eſt.

sp.speaker: ELI.
sp.l: Plaudite, filioli, Domino Iam quiſquis in armis
Optimus, apprenſos Salios conſtringat ahena
Torque, volo, demum vinctos huc ducite, Cydron
Laeta vbi latiflua Iordanis in arua palude
Praecipitatus abit, nondum indignatus in aequor
Aſphalti horrendum mergi, Dominantis ob iram,

Sulphure quod rigido, craſſo
que bitumine ſtagnat.
Hîc cadet enſe meo Baalae pecus altile rapto.
Propiciatori Baalae hîc mactabo ſuorum
Corpora ſacrificûm: carnes voret ipſe cruentas
Si libet, ac partem Ieſabellae mittat in vrbem.

sp.speaker: HESIODVS.
sp.l: Molitur damnum ipſe ſibi, qui intentat alij,

Conſilium
que malum Autori fert maxima damna.

div.p:
His pro tempore breuiſs. reliqua cum caeteris copioſius ad integrum tractatum reſeruans, Autor, non animo diuagandi non furore erroneo non ſcurrarum more nec ſcelere, ſed ſpe opt. max. vltro libenter
que , obitu C.S. fratris deſiderio, Chriſtiani nominis nomine, philoſophiae ſobriae ſtudio, honoris, conſcientiae
que ſaluae amore, inconſtantia, vi & iniuria temporum huc & in terram pace Religione
que beatiſs. pulſus,
